dcterms:creator: Jordi Pages
Luca Marchionni
Francesco Ferro
dcterms:description: The TIAGo robot is a mobile manipulator designed in a modular way, capable of performing various tasks and experiments related to self-recognition and self/other distinction.
dcterms:title: TIAGo Robot

dcterms:creator: Eero P Simoncelli
dcterms:description: An optical flow algorithm used to extract visual movement directions and centroids from visual input, aiding in the robot's ability to perceive its actions and their effects.
dcterms:title: Optical Flow Algorithm

dcterms:creator: Christopher M Bishop
dcterms:description: Mixture Density Networks (MDN) are used to model the relationship between the robot's actions and the sensory effects produced, allowing for robust learning and prediction.
dcterms:title: Mixture Density Networks (MDN)

dcterms:creator: Guillermo Oliver
Pablo Lanillos
Gordon Cheng
dcterms:description: This dataset involves experiments on active inference related to body perception and action in humanoid robots, focusing on self-recognition capabilities.
dcterms:title: Active Inference Body Perception

dcterms:creator: James R Anderson
Gordon G Gallup Jr
dcterms:description: The Self-Recognition Mirror Test is a behavioral experiment used to assess self-recognition abilities in various species, including robots in this context.
dcterms:title: Self-Recognition Mirror Test

dcterms:creator: Pablo Lanillos
Emmanuel Dean-Leon
Gordon Cheng
dcterms:description: This dataset explores the concept of sensorimotor contingencies and how they yield self-perception in robots, contributing to self/other distinction.
dcterms:title: Sensorimotor Contingencies
